author: kimrock

text:
Saw your comment and couldn't help doing some research on MobyGames.

Kyouhei Sada left Natsume after making the soundtrack for Spanky's Quest and started PURE SOUND, where he now works under the name Kiyohiro Sada. PURE SOUND still composes and produces music for video games, mobile devices, pachinko machines and commercials as well as developing music composition software. His most recent Video Game involvement was in Riviera: The Promised Land and Summon Night: Swordcraft Story.

text: For some reason this is just one of my favorite songs you've ever uploaded. The game itself is terrible, but the lively feel of this track really made me fall in love with it almost immediately. I love the vibrato in the synth, because it gives it a very oceanic, very surfer-like feel.

text:
God I remember this game and the original Super Monkey Ball back in the early 90's for the SNES.... Great times!

But now that I am actually talking about these 2 games for the first time in 20 years leads me to question:

Were both Spanky's Quest and Super Monkey Ball related?

text: This and City are my two favorite tracks from this game. I really like this kind of upbeat, groovy SNES synth music. I replayed this game to check it out after I last uploaded a track from this game and yeah, except for the music, it hasn't aged very well.
